article: The Newspaper Boy  Billy is fourteen years old and in the ninth grade. He has a part-time _ which gets him up every morning at five o'clock. He is a _ boy.  Each morning, Billy _ the house at 5:15 to go to the corner _ the newspapers are. The newspapers were _ to the corner _ truck at midnight. He always takes a wagon to carry them.  In the winter it is still _ when he gets up, but during the rest of the year it is light. Billy must deliver the newspapers to the _ of people on his route in all kinds of weather. He tries to put each paper on the porch where it will be protected _ wind and rain or snow. His _ think he does a good job. Sometimes they give him tips.  Billy _ about $70 per month, and he is saving some of the money to go to _ . He _ the rest on records and clothes. Once a month, he has to _ money form his customers. Since many of them work during the day, Billy has to collect the money at _ . Sometimes, when Billy is _ , his older brother has to deliver the newspapers. Once, Billy's father had to help.  Billy has seventy _ now, but he hopes to get _ soon. Someday, if he gets many more customers, Billy might win a prize for being an outstanding newspaper boy. He wants to win a _ to Europe, but he will be _ if the wins a new bicycle.
